hook.text: About 68% of the world can't properly digest milk. Tolerance is the exception, not the rule.

buildup.text: Babies produce lactase to digest breast milk. In most humans, lactase drops sharply after weaning.

discovery.text: Northern Europeans evolved persistent lactase due to thousands of years of dairy farmingâ€”a rare mutation.

twist.text: Lactose intolerance isn't a disease. It's the biological default for most adult humans on Earth.

climax.text: Fermented dairy like yogurt and aged cheese contain far less lactose and are usually well tolerated.

punchline.text: Milk tolerance is the mutation. Intolerance is normal.

quiz.question: What percentage of the world is lactose intolerant?
